Reviews.Title: Bang for the bucks
Reviews.Author: Elo Nnabuife "Mr LomLom"
Reviews.Content: Received the cameras 2 days after order was placed. I followed the instructions on Foscam website and had all installations completed within 1. Both viewing it on my home network and over the internet.Videos are clear! Controlling the camera remotely is awesome and works flawlessly so far. The ability to hear sound and also send audio is terrific. I bought it to use my baby monitor and it seems to be excellent. Of cause it is less than 24 hours that I have had them but I don't see it going bad. I am still playing with the motion detector because I set the sensitivity at 10, and it captured so many videos. I will play with that later.If anything goes wrong, I will make an update to the review. I plan to get 2 more, but for outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Five-Star Product, One-Star Support
Reviews.Author: Roger V
Reviews.Content: The Foscam F18910W is an very good IP camera at a good price.  Once setup and functioning, it is easy to operate and very effectively allows me to monitor my home while traveling. However, unless you're knowledgeable about IP's, how to establish a website, proxies, etc. you will need to allow a substantial amount of time to educate yourself or find a friend with the necessary understanding and get them to help you set it up.  There was effectively no technical support available to me from Foscam despite my various efforts.  First thing you're told in a recorded message when you call them is that if you purchased the camera from Amazon or another retailer rather than directly from them, they will not help you unless you pay them and let them remotely control your computer.  They did indicate that you could email a specific question to them for assistance, and I did try that but never heard back from them.  Then after trying to follow the somewhat incomplete instructions that came with the camera, I decided I would pay their fee, but was never able to reach a human in order to do that.  Ultimately, I got help from a friend's son who does this sort of work for a living and who guided me through the rest of the setup process.

Reviews.Title: Easy Ultra Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Bill "SSgt_USAF"
Reviews.Content: I dont know why there are so many negative reviews on these cameras on Amazon. I know that the company selling these is spamming the reviews but, as you can see, my purchase is verified.I had used a Summer Infant Baby Touch Digital Color Video Monitor for quite some time and went through 3 cameras and two handsets. I finally gave up and bought these two cameras. If you are using these as baby monitors I would suggest the black version as the white ones have an LED inside of them that lights up pretty bright and can be seen through the white plastic. Here is how I set them up:First I plugged them into power and an ethernet port on my router.Then I logged into my router and saw what IP address they were assigned.I then typed the IP address into firefox (or pale moon for 64bit).I logged into the camer using admin and no password (on firefox and chrome you must use second login button).I then went straight to the devide settings and wireless.I checked wireless check box and clicked scan.I chose my network out of box and typed in my password.I clicked submit and when the camera started to reboot and the network lights came on I unplugged the network cable.I then logged back into the router (actually I still had the page up) and got the new wireless IP address.I logged back into camera and changed password and port to 8090 (8091 on second camera).Repeated all steps for second camera.Setup tinyCam Monitor PRO on my 10 inch android tablet and added camera info for both cameras.All of this took maybe 20 minutes including putting cameras in my childrens rooms.Overall theses cameras have superb pictures compared to any other baby monitor I have seen. For $189 total, including tinycam pro, I have the sweetest baby monitor setup. If oyu follow the setup instructions I gave here you should be able to get this up and running no problem. Also, buy these from either foscam on amazon or from observeye. If oyu buy them elsewhere you will not get the two year warranty.UPDATE: 11/5/2012These cameras still work perfect. They restart every once in a while but always return the position that I set as home. I now use tinyCam PRO on both of our cellphones and on the tablet. Definitely worth the purchase.UPDATE: 12/21/2012The world did not end today!!! Also the cameras are still going strong. They restart a lot less now for some reason. There have not been any changes to our network but tinyCam Monitor PRO has been updated a few times through the Play Store.UPDATE 02/14/2013I had to buy a new wireless router for our house because the old one died. I think that the camera restarting issue was caused by slow network speed on my old router becuase they have not restarted in the last week that I have had the new router. I added entries for the wireless cameras into the new router to assign static ip addresses to them and I used port forwarding to forward port 8090 to the one camera and 8091 to the other camera. I used a DynDns account to keep a hostname associated to my dynamic ip and can now access the cameras from anywhere using the hostname and port number. The router I got was a WNDR3400 V2, I highly recommend this router as it is fast!

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W two-pack
Reviews.Author: P. Totten "Music fan"
Reviews.Content: I placed my order on Saturday and it was on my doorstep Monday afternoon. It took me about 2 hours to figure out the installation. I'm not a computer expert. But I can read instructions. Have your router user manual handy and refer to Foscam.us website for additional setup instructions. It's all there. You just need to poke around for the answers.If you're planning on mounting the camera on a ceiling or high up on a wall...keep in mind the camera requires power...therefore you'll need a wall outlet near your mounting point. The camera does not run on batteries.I also downloaded the $4.99 Foscam Pro Surveillance app for my iPhone...great app!! Takes about 2 minutes to set it up.All in all, I'm very pleased with my purchase and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Wish I knew....
Reviews.Author: M. W. Long "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews since most of the time the information has already been covered by others. This time it is different. I gave the system a 3 star rating. The cameras themselves, based on price and performance actually earned 5 stars. The accompanying Foscam software earned 1 star (since 0 stars is not an option) so 3 stars is what I awarded. The Foscam software is garbage. Save yourself a lot of time and effort and use it to initially get the cameras working on your LAN and then forget about it. Purchase Blue Iris and use it. It is awesome, easy to use, intuitive and reliable. It is everything the Foscam software is not.Foscam's Tech. Support is slow and their forums are full of issues, some quite old for the computer age, which are still causing user problems. I did get a response after a couple of days. All they did was ask for a screen shot of my issue with getting the email to work. I configured it exactly the way it was shown in the online guide. I even got an account at the same service as they supposedly use. It didn't work! It appears that the examples on their website are untested. It never did work but with Blue Iris, I got email working in less than 2 minutes after wasting a good part of a day with the Foscam software.There were a lot of errors when try to configure things using Internet Explorer that were remedied by using Firefox. They admit right up front that Internet Explorer is the only browser that will support multiple cameras. I think it is the only one they could configure. Firefox and Google Chrome should be able to do it, too. By the way their multiple cameras set up didn't work for me either. On the camera remote login they don't even know how to sense what browser you are using. It has two login buttons, one for IE and one for the others. That is absurd. It is obvious that their software is not ready for prime time. In summary good cams, bad software, get good software and things will work fine. At least they did for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Economical Price
Reviews.Author: Phast Phil "Phast Phil"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras and have set one up on my home network.  The other camera is going to another location, which I have not set up yet.My first impressions of the quality and features were very good. Build quality is nice, however not what I would call heavy duty.  For a HOME or Office environment, I think they will work just fine.  IMHO it won't hold up in an industrial environment well.  I'm a certified Network Engineer, so getting this up and running was pretty easy and working it into my home wired and wireless network/router was painless.  But, if you don't have a lot of experience or have a LOT of patience, you might not find this easy.  If the terms PORT FORWARDING, DHCP or Static IP make your palms sweaty, you might find an experienced friend to help.  The supplied 10 page manual, one for Windows and one for MAC, are not translated very well, and you will need to interpret the meaning carefully.  After reading the manual, I still had questions and called their TECH SUPPORT, which 'sounded' like it was forwarded to China (over SKYPE).  The connection was not good, and the technician was not fully fluent in English.  However, I did get my question answered and I moved ahead with my install.  I was up and running in about 10 minutes.Side note: I did NOT want to use the CAMERA TOOL SW they supplied, I wanted the challenge of setting it up on my own.  If you have some experience, let me save you a few head scratches: The FI8910W does NOT have a Static IP address.  You can't just set one.  It pulls an IP from the ROUTER.  You can find the IP address by looking in your router MAC table and matching the WIRED MAC address with your router IP assignment.  Then just plug in that IP of the camera into ur browser and continue the setup (USER/PASSWORD/Resolution etc).  Really Simple.  BTW, Wireless setup was just as easy, just SCAN find ur SSID, provide ur wireless password and pull the LAN cable (it won't support both).  Again, look in the router MAC assignments, and find the WIRELESS MAC address and use your browser to log into the camera.  One piece of advice: If your router allows you to SAVE the IP address locked to the MAC address, I suggest you do that immediately after finding the IP.  This way if you unplug or turn off the camera it will search for a NEW IP address and you might be chasing the camera IP in your router again.  (I saw a lot of Forum comments about this and I could see where this would be frustrating).The Pan and Tilt has one medium speed, but there is a Auto PAN that will continuously PAN the camera if desired.  All P&T; functions are accessible from the main screen.  I was able to control the camera with my iPhone, and the FI8910W was smart enough to lower the screen RES to match the iPhone (vs the higher 640/480 for a desktop).  Picture quality is very good, but there is a LOT of barrel distortion from the very wide angle lens they use.  It does give you a huge horizontal view, which is what you want in a security camera.  I have not tested the IR night vision or the Snap Shot or notification feature yet.  I'll amend this review once I get that working.  I intend to add this camera to my 3 other security cameras in a MAC application by Security Spy (MAC ONLY).  I use iCamViewer which to my surprise supported the Foscam camera perfectly.4 Stars is still a very good rating, but I dropped 1-star for lack of a good manual and confusing warranty/tech support.

Reviews.Title: Dreadful customer service
Reviews.Author: Samben Golden Retrievers
Reviews.Content: Item arrived, appeared to be as described.  Repeated efforts at making wireless connection were unsuccessful.  This after spending time reviewing documentation in box, as well as at Foscam's website, including YouTube tutorials.  Calls to company for technical support were so bad as to be laughable.Two (yes, not one, two) representatives (neither of whom spoke passable English) hung up on me once I made clear I was having a problem establishing a wireless connection in a Mac environment.  I placed a third call, asking immediately (wait for it - after the 15 minute wait for someone to come on the line) to speak with a supervisor.  I was again placed on hold, and then informed the supervisor had "other" things to do and would not have time to speak with me.I asked for an RMA, noting that if customer service supervisors did not find me, a customer, a priority, then I had no further need of them.  I was then told that although the company uses Amazon as their seller, the company had no real relationship with Amazon and hence could not help me with an RMA.  So I will asking Amazon for an RMA and simply avoid this company henceforth.A further note:  my efforts at effecting a wireless installation on a Mac revealed a multitude of complaints and vast confusion among fellow purchasers/ users as to how to achieve this.  Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Overall good product for price
Reviews.Author: Lohocla
Reviews.Content: 4 stars only due to the active-x control that forces you to set this up using internet explorer.  Set up is pretty simple and the wireless has good range.  Pan/Tilt speed can be adjusted (default is pretty sluggish, but at it's fastest is pretty darn fast)You can still use other browsers to view, but for full configuration of where to store images on your hard drive, you need to use IE.  You also need to keep the browser open to save video/images.  I use I-Spy which is free and can be minimized to your system tray.  Has a ton of features.Camera does well indoors, the IR LEDs provide excellent illumination in a light colored room, but due to the .5 lux rating, it struggles in a dark colored room (IR reflects more on white walls than wood paneling or dark blue walls etc).If you're looking to use this camera pointed out of a window, do NOT expect this to work well.  The IR reflection from the LED's when on blind the camera (an issue with ALL IR cameras with the LED's positioned around the lens) and the LUX rating of .5 makes this camera return a mostly black image when the IR is turned off.So, again, indoor = acceptable to great, pointed outside = acceptable during the day, worthless at night (without modifications).

Reviews.Title: 5 FPS over wired connection - Tech support did not help
Reviews.Author: Modus Pwnd
Reviews.Content: I ordered a two pack and each camera performed horribly.  Over wireless I got less than 1 FPS.  Over wired I got about 5.  I contacted tech support and all they did was refer me to FAQs about wireless performance.  No help or explanation as to why they only get 5 FPS over a fast wired connection.  I returned the cameras.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERAS!!!
Reviews.Author: Zakatronics
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely impressed with the quality of these cameras not to mention the interface. Takes a bit to set them up, which includes IP addresses, some port forwarding in your router depending on how strict your firewall is, and other basic settings. Once you're past all that, you'll keep opening your browser or mobile app just to see how awesome and easy it is. Personally I use one as a baby monitor for our baby boy and the other as a video monitor for my electronics room.What I love about the Foscam F18910W:- two way audio- crisp video quality- ability to turn the camera in almost all directions using a "joystick" on the browser and mobile app- very good range- infrared is very clear and very little noise compared to other IP camerasNote: If you buy these and plan to use them with an iPad or iPhone, I highly recommend purchasing the Foscam Pro app. It costs $5.99 but is worth every single penny. Very user friendly, supports up to 16 of these cameras. I've purchased others and the one that I believe is the best is Foscam Pro. It'll work with other brands as well as per my tests.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: JSamJr "Watcher"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the two pack and they arrived in 5 days with standard shipping.  The packaging was very good and the cameras arrived without any damage.  I unpacked one camera  hooked it to may Macintosh network via ethernet cable and set it up according to the directions.  While wired the camera worked perfectly.  It is controlled via a web browser, in my case Safari and Firefox.  Great color and resolution.  Tilt and pan. Turn on and off the IR function.Problem began with setting up the wireless functions.  Before you start you should get the following info about your network: Network name (SSID) , the type of Encryption your network uses and the Share Key (Network Password). A program included on the CD is used to identify the cameras IP address.  This does not work instantly and you may have to wait or rescan it a few times before the IP address comes up.  Be patient.  The problem I had was selecting the correct encryption from the dropbdown menu.  When one selection didn't work I tried the next until I found one that worked.  Once I got the setting correct it work flawlessly.I was going to use the camera in a barn, about 70 feet away from the house, to keep an eye on the animals but the cameras range was too small.  I solved this by putting an Airport Express (802.11n) in the barn to extend the wireless network.  If you can string an ethernet cable to the remote location, you can dispense with the wireless problems and the camera will respond faster.  I may do this in the future. 150 Ft of CAT6 outdoor/direct burial patch cord is only around $60, CAT5 about half as much.The camera has been up and running for 4 days now with no problems.  At night, you can use the IR function to see.Next I will try to set up remote access.Overall I'm pleased with the product.  I'm no IT expert and with a little patience anyone can figure out how to get it up and running

Reviews.Title: PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Chad P.
Reviews.Content: I wish to start by saying that I am not here to bash Foscam, as I think it could be the technology itself that is so frustrating with these cameras.  Here is my story:  I read a lot of great reviews regarding these cameras which is why I chose Foscam.  I also chose Foscam because they were supposed to be compatible with Mac.  A few reviews stated that they were challenging to set up.  I have a degree in Automation technology, and I am quite proficient with computers, so I was not overly concerned about that.  They arrived quickly.  I was quite impressed with the construction, finish, and design.  They seemed to be well built.  I took out the disc and the manual.  I always read and follow the instructions. I inserted the CD, and the manual stated to download the camera IP folder.  This first step did not work.  Also, it was a zip file for the mac, but a standard file for the PC. (Not so fair for mac users).  I do not have zip software on my mac because I do not normally deal with large files.  Anyway, I bought the zip software for $29.00.  I found out later that there was a free trial, but it was too late.  I already purchased the regular version of it.  Anyway, I did not think that this was a big deal if I could get the cameras to work.  So, I tried to open the file again, and it did not work.  I emailed the zip file company, and they stated that they were having difficulty with certain files opening.  Nice.  I called Foscam and they suggested downloading the file directly from their website.  This worked.  OK.  Finally, I got step one over with.  I think I should mention here that when you call Foscam, they always want to access your computer remotely.  OK, this sounds like a REALLY BAD IDEA.  Okay, I then plugged the camera into my router and proceeded to try to understand all of the steps.  I finally got it to work while plugged in.  After quite a bit of time, I got it to work wirelessly in the house.  I thought I was going to be home free.  I could not get the audio to work, but everything else seemed to be working fine.  Well, The next step is to be able to view the camera from a remote location by typing in a web address.  This involved too many steps to go into here.  It is like a crazy puzzle that you just cannot solve.  I tried to use the website that they suggested in order to obtain an address.  The port forwarding is a nightmare.  I followed the manual, the videos, etc. and I could never get them to work.  I thought that perhaps my cable company was blocking ports.  I called them, and they were not blocking the ports that I was trying to use.  I cannot stress how much time all of this took.  I want to say that I was using all of my spare time for about a week to try and get these things to work.  I do NOT like to give up, but this time I did.  I thought about a certain movie, a rap song, an open field, and a baseball bat (if you know what I mean).  But then I calmed down, and gently placed them neatly into their little boxes and sent them back to Amazon.  I REALLY wanted these to work!!  I do not think that these are for the average consumer.  I believe the community college could teach an entire class on this subject.  I realized later that most of the positive reviews I read were from people who did not view the cameras remotely.  Many of them just wanted to see their kids in the next room.  Also, the only audio that I found to work was an app on my ipod touch.  That actually worked well.  Foscam emailed me and told me that the audio is not compatible with a mac.  They stated that you have to use other software for it.  I tried, and could not get it to work on my mac book pro.This camera would be fine for those who A) Have unlimited patience.  B)  Only want to use them within the household, and not view them remotely.  C) Have excellent skills in advanced routing, surveillance cameras, web hosting, etc.Again, I am not here to bash.  I am just being honest.  I have never been so frustrated with a piece of equipment in my whole life.  I think perhaps this is a technology that is not quite perfected yet.  I hope that they will do so in the future so I can try again.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: JAMES HILL KOCHKA
Reviews.Content: I ordered 6 of these (three 2-packs) so my family and I could make sure our elderly mom was being looked after properly by her caregivers (while also discouraging any theft). After reading some of the other reviews I was a little concerned with the difficulty of installation. But I watched a couple of YouTube videos and went at it.  It was actually quite simple. The cameras do a great job and are easy to operate remotely.  I'm seriously thinking of getting some so I can watch my dog while I'm at work.

Reviews.Title: Great cameras with easy setup.
Reviews.Author: KBSguy
Reviews.Content: Nice simple inexpensive cameras with easy setup. Perfect for monitoring those key areas you need to keep an eye on when you're away.

Reviews.Title: if you don't need customer service
Reviews.Author: Henry Kipp
Reviews.Content: knowing exactly how and where these are going to be mounted and having a strong signal and direct line of sight with no bothersome shielding (has any manufacturer ever mentioned that the internal anti reflective coating on thermopane windowsaluminum siding, standing seam steel, and and the reflective foil on some gypsum board and most insulation, particularly the prehardened foam variety, all act like shields?);and don't expect any service staff to know about Windows 8, or computers in general;if you get them at a significant discount off retail and know what you are doing, they are a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera except for night vision
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: Good camera for daytime and good lighting conditions. Really good features as far as administrative settings. Worthless as far as night vision goes. Mine certainly did not have vision 8 meters in the dark. I could turn on and off the i/r setting and see the i/r lights come on and off but it made no difference. Unless I got a faulty camera, only purchase this if there will be some light in the area. Other than that you will like this system.

Reviews.Title: Foscam techncial support
Reviews.Author: Martin Trisdorfer
Reviews.Content: I was able to connect easily to my home network wirelessly, but had trouble with connecting by internet. I called Foscam tech support, who called back within 15 minutes. Ralph Mendez assisted me through the setup extremely quickly and efficiently.  The cameras work great, especially using the Foscam Pro app on my iPad. The cameras appear to be very well-made and durable. I highly recommend the camera and Foscam. Other competing cameras did not have the same features and quality.  The camera also makes a great baby monitor and is cheaper than the stand alone video baby monitors.

Reviews.Title: Great value cams
Reviews.Author: C. Meyer
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say these are the best IP cameras ever.. but, if you're looking at reviews of this, I will assume that you don't (like me) have $1k to spend on the best. For the price, I am thoroughly satisfied and would recommend these to anyone who wants security on a budget.These cams are loaded with features, but not for the casual user. I had both up and running (and able to access from anywhere via port forwarding) in 30 mins. If you're stuck in the 90's and still use the "I'm not good with computers" cop out, and don't have niece/nephew that can help, then don't order these.

Reviews.Title: Excellent IP Cameras
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: PROSINSTALL- Read install instructions on Foscam website.  Took 2 hours to install and configure all three camerasEASY TO VIEW REMOTELY- On home network, Internet, or iPhoneREMOTE CONTROLS- Work perfectly.  Can aim in different directions from home network, Internet (haven't tried on phone)AUDIO- ExcellentIR LEDs- Surprisingly good illumination in a dark room, or at nightPOWER- No problems as long as they are plugged into a wall outletCONS- The install is time consuming.  Not really a Foscam issue since it takes time to install an IP camera.Overall, great cams.  Purchased one 2 years ago, no problems with it.  Just bought 2 more.  Obviously really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: out of the box with something loose inside
Reviews.Author: CW
Reviews.Content: Just got the 2 pack, even though the bottom of the camera had a quality control sticker I immediately noticed something loose and rattling around inside the case, maybe a screw maybe something else, not sure.  Definitely not good quality, shipping these hunks of junk back and getting a different brand. *side note- not sure if this related to amazons quality but this is the 4 item in 8 weeks I had to ship back to amazon.  Yea they're cheper than retail stores but is it really worth the hassle???  I think I am going back to local stores.

Reviews.Title: Great Foscam ip cam
Reviews.Author: Shirin M. O. Khorchid
Reviews.Content: This is my third ip camera from Foscam really happy of the product and clarity of the image, very reasonable price and performance. I do recommend this camera for home survalence or baby monitoring. Thanks

Reviews.Title: quit working within days
Reviews.Author: Mark Anderson
Reviews.Content: I have a foscam 8918w and love it so I purchased two of these. The image quality was an improvement but in less than 30 days both stopped working properly. One had a total UV fail about 4 days in. The other's UV would turn on and off and eventually failed completely. The company is taking care of it, hence the two stars, but they must of had a bad production run.

Reviews.Title: Solid movable, wireless camera for wide angle views
Reviews.Author: West
Reviews.Content: Cameras easily set up and operated via wireless network through utility on CD and free iPad app.  Wide angle viewing good day and night/IR, although resolution does not allow for detailed security uses such as license plate recording (not a negative, just a factor in selecting correct camera for desired use).  Motion detected email photos are great, although motion sensitivity results in multiple false alarms.  Very solid for beginner security via remote access at low cost with DIY set up.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: Harsh
Reviews.Content: Good Camera for the price.. there are couple thing one needs to know though.Setup is little difficult it is not just plug and play one will need to tinker around with router setting and Camera setting.Also setting up of DNS which the direction claims is free is no longer a free service they charge additional $20 per year fee now.Picture quality is nice and even the night vision is pretty good for indoor use.

Reviews.Title: Use it for baby room
Reviews.Author: Love Outdoors "Love WI"
Reviews.Content: I love these cameras.  Setup as a breeze.  I still need to work on port forwarding so I can see from outside my network, but I love them.  The good news is you can not hear the camera tilt or pan. My toddler doesn't even know it exists.  Highly recommend. I use my iPhone and IPad to observe from the other rooms of my house.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: meegz
Reviews.Content: These cameras are a fantastic quality. It did take quite awhile to connect them, but after a long conversation with customer service was able to get them to work. We haven't had a problem since. I also wanted to mention that the customer service call was free. I had read some reviews that said they were offered service for a price.

Reviews.Title: Hesitate, Think Very Hard Before Buying
Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I waited to install these cameras which in retrospect was quite stupid of me. I cannot return them, I'm over the return period. NOTE: I've been an Amazon member and have spent "thousands of dollars" actually I'm a Prime Member. I'm simply taking an educated guess here, however it seems Amazon has come to be perhaps too big. The quality, descriptions, etc. in my experience for the past six months with regard to their "Product Descriptions" has been remarkably inaccurate.I've never written a review before, however with regard to these cameras I can't simply let this slide. The actual night I purchased these the header for the ad stated they were "Indoor/Outdoor" which I kept questioning, but took them for their word. Within literally hours of my purchase the "Indoor/Outdoor" had disappeared from the ad? I did email the seller regarding this fluke although to no surprise I did not receive a response. I was trying to simply avoid the problem before it started. Having not heard back from the seller I actually and stupidly did not attempt to install them until just a couple days ago. Too late.What I can share with you. These do not appear to be "Indoor/Outdoor" cameras what so ever. In my opinion after having to call tech support especially after reading all the glowing reviews with regard to how "Helpful" they are I've come to believe this is a huge, naturally profit driven set of individuals who are obviously being paid per call, per sale with regard to support. I have chosen not to name the support individual who answered my call after 40 minutes of wait time last night as I don't aspire to embarrass him in particular. However it was clear to this man this was about selling more cameras and obtaining glowing reviews. After this individual who I could not understand but maybe every 4th word finished the remote set up, he actually asked in a somewhat expectant manner for me to open my Amazon account. I had to ask him "what did you just say" as I just could not believe he was requiring me to open up my Amazon account to him. When I asked why, he indicated this was for me to write him a good review. When he caught onto the idea I knew what he was up to he backed right off indicating that "most people on Amazon don't know how to write reviews so he was simply helping me" C'mon, I wasn't born yesterday and spent 33 years in sales. This call was a few minutes of totally unexplained support, 45 seconds of attempting to get into my Amazon account, another 45 seconds of making me aware to buy any additional Foscam cameras from him as he would furnish me a discount, and another 30 seconds of making sure I wrote a review mentioning his name in particular. In my opinion this is a very well put together team of salespeople first, and tech support the vehicle being utilized to furnish so many glowing reviews subsequently selling more cameras. I was wary of the glowing reviews, along with the changing description. And I will say it's my opinion this is a fairly well oiled machine sadly pushing a substandard product.As for the cameras, the set up, the ability to get out of them what you want, be very careful. Its apparent to me now all these are really going to do is allow you to open the icon that is labelled "IP Camera Tool" The tool makes you click on an IP address which opens another window for you to see the image the camera is pointed at. Control of the camera is very slow, you are not going to follow a deer running across your yard. I've not really found nor explored how one would go about writing all this to some type of storage, it may have that capacity, however you had better be an IT person. In the rushed set up via tech support you are explained nothing, and understanding the individual I had was impossible therefore I just let him go about his business. Sadly nothing what so ever is explained, nor are you offered any explanation as to why, what, or how. Therefore, providing you simply want to sit at your computer and view a remote image is what your goal is, then purchase one. Other than that I do believe you will find this to be a very accurate review.NOTE: I blame Amazon as much as the team put together to forcefully sell as many of these units as possible. Amazon is perhaps come to be too large a company to review the practices of their sellers. These people are not interested so much in customer satisfaction, but far more in how many units sold. I hope this review is not taken down, or somehow disappears as I think its just as important for the buyer to be aware of the company behind the product as well as the product. My suggestion is pay more, but look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great Cameras for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought these and the Blue Iris software after my home was broken into. Setup was easy for me (IT background) but may be a little harder for some, especially with modem settings. I would definitely recommend these cameras.

Reviews.Title: great as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I love these cameras.  They are easy to use and you can watch the video from any device or computer/internet connection.  I love that you can see and hear two pictures at once - it has worked out great as a baby monitor for 2 kids in separate rooms.  I can watch them from work or the car or anywhere.  My husband's brother said it took him forever to get it set up, but my husband said it was fine, so I'm betting his brother (as usual) just didn't want to take the time to read the directions.

Reviews.Title: Security  Cameras
Reviews.Author: Ray T
Reviews.Content: Had a few problems with the cameras;however,Foscam continued workin with me to rectify the problem.  New cameras were issued.  Their tech. Dept. got my camera's working as they should.  Thank you Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910w cam
Reviews.Author: JIaozhen Wang
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this Camera. It's a excellent products for security. And Foscam has great customer support. When I called Foscam customer suppost, Mr Irish answered all my question, then My camera are working. IF you have any question, just call customer support of Foscam, they will do everything for you.

Reviews.Title: Be ready to put in some work.
Reviews.Author: Tarishma Bruster
Reviews.Content: I purchased 8 of these to monitor/record my home. My elderly father lives with me and I need to keep an eye on him.  Shipping was fast. Boxes were in perfect shape. These cameras are unnecessarily large. The circuit board is housed in the base that seems like it can be half the size.  The mounts are made from plastic and have to be large to accommodate the large camera. The construction is all plastic. Now to the set up... The power adapters are only 6ft long, so be prepared to run extension cords or buy the extension cables. If you are installing more than one of these, it is best you configure them before installing them. One by one, I connected each to my network via Ethernet and made all the configurations via web console. You will create a user account, name the camera and set up a ton of other stuff like email notifications, brightness etc. You will join them to your wifi via the web console as well.  There are 2 separate firmware updates that need to be done, one for the camera itself, the other for the web console.  The cameras will reboot after each update. When they connect to your network, you have to use this really silly IP Camera utility to see their IP's and MAC address. The tool constantly refreshes and rearranges the list of cameras.  This was frustrating for setting up 8.  There is a way to configure up to 9 cameras at a time, but I saw that later.  You will need to be familiar with your router and setting up port forwarding if you want to see the video over the internet. I also recommend creating DHCP reservations for each camera, that way if the camera is rebooted it will come back online using the same IP. I purchased the Blue Iris software which basically turns your pc into a web server. If you are installing more than one of these I highly recommend the Blue Iris software, since you only need to set up port forwarding once for the software only.  My gripe with these cameras is that they constantly drop signal.  They will drop signal and randomly come back online. I even replaced my wireless router with an ASUS RT-AC66U which was a major upgrade in signals for all my other wifi devices.  I just purchased the 9dbi foscam antennas to replace the current ones, hopefully that works. The other gripe is that the IR is really loud, it makes a loud click when it switches back and forth between normal and IR.  These are one of those products that you just don't know how it will turn out until you actually complete the entire install, and at that point you have invested so much time...

Reviews.Title: Foscam support
Reviews.Author: Brian Overstreet
Reviews.Content: Calvin on the Foscam Tech Support line was very helpful is getting my cameras connected wirelessly and remotely.  Much appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: Nice cameras`
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: For simple surveillance of the house when we are not home these cameras work well. They are very simple to install and operate.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the money
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: For a little less than $75 each, I don't think these can be beat.  I'm using both as security cameras on opposite sides of my house.  I have them fixed to the wall at the edge of the window looking out the window at an angle.  The included mounting bracket is sturdy and excellent for positioning the camera inside looking out a window.  I also like the retractable ethernet cable that comes with the device.  I didn't need it but I'll sure use that for other projects and is handy to have.  :-)Software was straightforward and if you've set up other IP cameras in the past, this one will be similar.  WiFi range seems good.  The cameras have very good color during day but my one complaint (and reason for only 4 stars) is that there's a gotcha with the IR LED's.  You can turn them off but they default to on when the camera reboots so if there's a power outage and they are not on a UPS, you'll have trouble if you want them off permanently (as I do shooting out a window).  Even if you turn them off after boot, at night the low light capabilities are pretty poor because with the IR LED's shut off, the camera stays in daytime mode and won't switch to night vision (B/W) mode.The solution for me was to cut a ring of foil tape and cover the IR LED's making sure not to cover the light sensor at the top.  Doing that and leaving the IR turned ON in the software ensures that the camera switches to night vision mode but the LED's don't blind the camera from window reflections.  With the foil tape in place, the camera switches to B/W IR mode at night which is much more sensitive even without the LED's turned on.  It means you can get usable footage when your outdoor spot or patio light comes on.  Sort of like "moonlight" mode on other cameras.  I was surprised to see that it appears this device has a retractable IR filter.  So during the day you get beautiful accurate color and when it switches to night mode via the light sensor, the IR filter retracts and you get the ghostly irradiated B/W image we are all used to with night vision (even with the IR LED's covered up).  All my other IR capable cameras have no IR filter so during the day they give a horrible purple image.  Not this camera: seems to have the best of both worlds!One "glitch" I found in the firmware was that if you try to access the streaming video from more than one device at a time, the WebUI sometimes "hangs" and you have to unplug power to get it back.  The camera is still visible with the included software: you just can't get to the WebUI because the multi-user access has somehow locked it up.  Not much of a concern since you can avoid that.  I do have the latest firmware as of this date (April 19, 2014).Finally, I didn't try the included motion detection and alert parts of the software because I use BlueIris for that.  These cameras work nicely with BlueIris.  Overall I'm quite impressed for the money as some of my other IP cameras that cost 3x as much do less.  The tilt and pan options are good and have a very wide range.  Only complaint on that is if you set a preset spot and then "Go" to that spot from the left, it returns to a slightly different horizontal position than if you start from the right.  This is because there seems to be several degrees of "slop" in the horizontal movement.If the firmware is ever upgraded to allow permanent "off" for the IR LED's while STILL allowing the camera to go into night/moonlight mode at night, this camera would be a grand slam 5 star device!Mike

Reviews.Title: Good, decent survellance cameras
Reviews.Author: lelams3c
Reviews.Content: These foscam cameras did their job by providing me good access to view my home when I am at work. One thing I would like to inform everyone who is trying to set up these cameras at home. If your ISP is timewarner (especially in the NYC area), you may want to set your cablem modem (if you have the ubee brand one) into the bridge mode. I have been trying multiple times to set up these cameras to no avail. But after I read online that you need to turn your cable modem to bridge mode then everything works for me.In terms of how to set your cable model to bridge mode, if you google "ubee modem bridge mode" it will tell you all the steps.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Defective products, wifi not functioning
Reviews.Author: James T. English
Reviews.Content: I have a Foscam FI8918W that I setup fine. I tried to set these up on my wifi and when I click "Scan" nothing happens. I updated the firmware and tried again and again when I click the scan button nothing happens. I tried manually entering my SSID and password and it doesn't seem to connect. I set my router to be "G" only (thinking it might have something to do with the B/G/N setting) and still nothing. The FI8918W worked right out of the box these however are expensive pieces of junk

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, poor instructions.
Reviews.Author: DoomsDayJ
Reviews.Content: Awesome cameras. Day/vision work amazingly! But a hell of a time installing them. Clearly a Chinese translation. But if you get on Youtube.com you can find plenty of help for what you need. Took me about 6 hours to install 2 cameras but believe, well worth the time! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: A great deal
Reviews.Author: Duotonex
Reviews.Content: To me, this was a steal of a deal for 2 of these cameras.  They are responsive, and come with a great amount of accessories to utilize in installation.  2 of these, combined with the "IP Camera Viewer" app for $5 on Google Play, and I have a home security system that would cost much much more if bought separately.  Bonus kudos to Amazon for helping out with a malfunctioning ac plug.

Reviews.Title: Cameras
Reviews.Author: Paul Blank
Reviews.Content: Almost impossible to figure out how to work these things. I had to call the company for help. I got some guy with a cleft palate or some kind of speech defect. I didn't want to be rude so I listened to his muttering for over 30 minuets. He finally got it to work. When I changed my modem the cameras have to be reinstalled. HELP!

Reviews.Title: Setting up cameras
Reviews.Author: R Blake Floyd
Reviews.Content: I  purchased 2 cameras , so far I have only one camera working and I can here the other camera clicking but it has not started working yet.(I have five of these cameras) I will give it a few more tries before I give up and say its not working.It was delivered ontime.

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: Thomas Tomczak
Reviews.Content: Not sure why, but I bought an 8910W in white, and the power cord was over 10 feet, also the camera is really nice, bought this two pack, and the power cords are about 3 feet making me buy the extensions...  Also, it took a while to setup the email... It didn't work, then it did with no change in settings...  if this could record, it would be perfect for what it is...  The night vision is amazing...I do recommend this...

Reviews.Title: Buy single packs
Reviews.Author: Lewis Blevins
Reviews.Content: No advantage to buying twi  pack over 2 separate cameras...I have to imagine 80 percent of these get returned  ... They work great, but you have to be full blown geek to get them to work.

Reviews.Title: over a year and they paid for them selves
Reviews.Author: James O'Hare "Jim O'Hare in Colorado"
Reviews.Content: I knew a neighbor was being funny but i was able to catch him at night slashing all 4 of my tires.I showed the police the video and they were able to get him to admit and pay me 800 bucks for new tires!  I bought a 2 pack in august 2012 and one is wireless (because front porch i did not want to drill thru bricks) but the other one is wired and while it gets better network i do not see a difference in the quality of the picture.  I leave them record and I let the Blue Iris software purge off any files older than 2 weeks.  I keep about 100 gig on my laptop and if I travel I can fire up my old laptop and allow it to capture the video files.Let me be clear, the software can be adjusted to save the files for a period of time or a certain number of files (or size).I think I paid 25 bucks for the Blue Iris software but if you do not want to save the video in case your neighbor did something then you can always simply plug them in and watch them from your phone or from a pc using a browser.I even showed someone my home from an airplane ride where they offered wifi!these are not even outdoor cameras! I have mine outside but under the overhang so they do not really get wet.  I like that I can hear audio and even talk into my phone and have my voice come out on the camera speaker (not the best sound but it works)I was just looking to see if they have anything better with a ZOOM but it looks like these are still the best for the buck...I keep waiting for them to die since they are outside but at this point I made my money back several times and none of my neighbors even knew I had them until I told them the story of the idiot slashing my truck tires. I wanted to give the truck to my nephew but the old tires never seemed to get any worse so I kept putting it off and a week after I bought the new ones I gave it to him...boy is he happy i bought these cameras!  Hope this helps someone make a decision, I looked for over a year before I made the decision and even if it just let me know what dogs are crapping in my yard it was worth it, but I still pull out the old video of num nuts looking around as he slashed each tire, and I think I would be in jail for retaliation but instead that guy is out of 800 bucks!life is now good in my castle.

Reviews.Title: see in the dark !
Reviews.Author: Dean K. Ellington
Reviews.Content: The setup is complex but worth the wait. I find these cameras very handy, I love the in fared feature. I added a louder external speaker and I find the wired setup provides a better picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Super easy setup, great functionality, and totally portable.
Reviews.Author: Russell M Steele
Reviews.Content: Ordered these as a quick and inexpensive way to watch areas of our home while we were away (pool area, main living area) without having to run cables or buy a base unit. These cameras are very easy to get up and running - even for IT novices - and they offer great features for remote monitoring (we used the iPad).

Reviews.Title: Great, but a bit difficult to set up.
Reviews.Author: DD
Reviews.Content: Cameras arrived in a timely manner and work well once configured properly.  For those individuals who are technologically challenged, you will most likely need asssistance.  Bradley, at Foscam Tech Support, was extremely competent, helpful and patient while setting up the cameras, port forwarding, etc.  He answered all questions thoroughly and was quite pleasant.  Thank you, Foscam, for providing such great support!  I would give a 5 star rating if it weren't so difficult to set up; and I have yet to use the cameras for any length of time to see how reliable they are.

Reviews.Title: foscam
Reviews.Author: Catherine Williams "SEWING"
Reviews.Content: Do setup my foscam the service was ATTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT good service harry foster his service was very good I like the the price is good and the picture on the foscam to very good with the remote address I can see my home when I am not there

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: TCA "Sin City Tim"
Reviews.Content: Work great. We have four of these in the house and can see everywhere we need to see.  Can keep track of the kids, the dogs, and watch for intruders all at the same time.

Reviews.Title: great customer support
Reviews.Author: Josh fulfer
Reviews.Content: These cameras work great. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a camera. 5 stars for foscam thanks. Irish was great help setting them up.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Michelle THANK YOU
Reviews.Author: Gregory C. Kneebone "greg"
Reviews.Content: I really like my foscam cameras ! they let me keep an eye on things at home , like checking on my dogs , who came to my front door and a pic of them. The up and down and left and right rotation is great for looking around at home where ever I am at in the world.When ever I have problems foscam is just a phone call away , they take my computer over remotely and take care of the problem wich is very rarely. I was looking at there web site saw there was soft ware upgrades , phoned up foscam and Michelle took over my computer and upgraded my software , she was inpressive on how to upgrade the software all said and done Michelle upgraded software got my cameras going and was great at comstomer service.thank you Michelle !!

Reviews.Title: Customer Support
Reviews.Author: Tv
Reviews.Content: I wanted to break this camera until I called support. Christina Aaron is a goddess!  she was so polite and helpful.. My iphone is now connected and alarm settings are working.Giving a 5 star because of Christina and now the cameras work great.THANKS!christina.aaron@foscam.us

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: T. Lindblom
Reviews.Content: We've had these cameras for over a year now and absolutely love them.  We can view our home from our I-Phone when we're away.  Their customer support is the best I've seen.  Sean was able to initially get us up and running and just recently when we installed a new modem, we lost all our settings.  I called Foscam and Ron Jacob got us up and running again!  He was great!  I have recommended these cameras to my friends and will continue to especially for the service we have received from Foscam.  Thanks Ron!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: william d. fruehling
Reviews.Content: Work well, but takes hours to figure setup out. I am average with computers but seems like I needed a degree in computer science to get them to work. They do work well once installed and working.

Reviews.Title: Foscam technical review and Camera review
Reviews.Author: STI
Reviews.Content: Bought these a little while back, but finally got around to installing them. Set up for an internal network was pretty easy and I was able to get them working in short order. Image quality is decent, night vision is really good. The interface might be a little clunky, but you can buy other software if you really want to expand the capabilities. The hard part was the port mapping on the Apple Airport. Gave it my best shot and failed. Called technical support and they set up the remote access for me in 5 minutes. Fast forward to getting the new Airport that just came out and i couldn't get the remote access working. Called Andrew in tech support and he quickly diagnosed the IP address change for the new router and had it fixed very quickly.I give them 5 stars for tech support and 4 for the camera/software. Still haven't got the sound working, but will tackle that another day. For now it does exactly what i wanted - able to log in and physically see what is going on in our home when we are away on vacation. A nice extra peace of mind. might consider buying the third party software to get the nicer interface especially for the mobile devices. However, it does work out of the box. Tech savvy people will do better than me on set up.

Reviews.Title: Great Cameras
Reviews.Author: Tony S.
Reviews.Content: These are well worth the price, the picture is pretty amazing for a camera at this price point. the pan/tilt works from phone, the ability to invert the picture is great for ceiling mounting. the night vision is dialed in just right.Some Observations: The microphone and speaker work however the clarity isn't super great. Setting these up is easy, However to save you some time, use different usernames and passwords on each unit, because if you use the same username for each camera, the software can differentiate which camera is which and you will have issues watching the cameras simultaneously.Hope the above helps someone with the install.

Reviews.Title: Great range of rotation and very easy to setup.
Reviews.Author: Mandy
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to setup these cameras. I started with the first camera, connected it to my internet modem using the interface cable provided in the box. Then I unplugged it once the software picked up the camera on the web browser and had my wireless modem pick it up. Then I repeated the steps for the second camera.  both cameras will send four to six video frames to my email when motion is detected. They have a great field of rotation and the software allows you to control the cameras remotelyThe only problem is, you can only view multiple cameras on internet explorer. In firefox and other non-IE browsers, the options do not include multi-camera setup. In addition, if you are outside the network, you can only view one camera unless you purchase a dedicated IP from one of several companies that offer this. If you are at home, its pretty easy to set up multiple cameras using the internal IPs. The video resolution is pretty good and the images are decent for the affordable price of these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W Great camera
Reviews.Author: Clark
Reviews.Content: I have several of these 640x480 color cameras with night vision capability. I don't use the IR for the most part but the cameras work very well with the Blue Iris software.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Tech Support for FI8910W 2Pack
Reviews.Author: David Chamberlain "4329908"
Reviews.Content: I called to get assistance configuring my cameras and router. I waited no more than 1 minute and was connected with Calvin. He connected to my desktop remotely and proceeded to configure the two cameras and the router within 2 minutes. Calvin is gets 5 stars, true professional.

Reviews.Title: FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: The cameras were very easy to set up. The support tech was fantastic.  The picture quality is very good.  I would recommend these cameras to anyone who is looking to purchase IP cameras.

Reviews.Title: fi8910w
Reviews.Author: ron
Reviews.Content: Great love themSupport is the best The features of the camera are excellent.I recomend this camera if you are looking for wireless.

Reviews.Title: pirate
Reviews.Author: hatescheapproducts
Reviews.Content: So far camera is great, could not install myself but had a very knowledgeable person to help  Need to be computer savvy.  Had to call help again to get these connected to my smart phone.  Took a long time but Ron Jacob was extremely helpful and very patient with me.  Success!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Lintao TAN
Reviews.Content: I am an international student that studying in US, this IP camera really helps me to keep my apartment safe when I go back to my own country.It's easy to play with it when you using the PC or other devices connecting to your home Wifi. But If you trying to use the camera outside by using 3G on your phone, it's a little bit complicated to set up the port forwarding things.The camera works perfect! 5 star~

Reviews.Title: Fun toy
Reviews.Author: Garrett Rall
Reviews.Content: I used them to spy on my dog. It has been a blast. It takes some technical know how or good googling skills to install and set up on a network.

Reviews.Title: Ilove the foscam
Reviews.Author: anh
Reviews.Content: Calvin his is very good serice ,i hope the company to excel in their tech support. I like the camera in the case of video quality and night vision. The camera is cheap and work well.

Reviews.Title: Easy View
Reviews.Author: Christine Pruneau
Reviews.Content: This camera works fantastic. I bought 2 cameras and they were easy to install and view from my android phone and mac computer.  Not being very technical savvy, I was able to connect most of it and with a quick call to tech support, they connected into my computer and connected the rest in no time. It was that easy to feel safe and secure!

Reviews.Title: Good customer support
Reviews.Author: Sundari
Reviews.Content: I had a problem trying to set up the camera. The support was really phenomenal. In 30 minutes bth cameras was set up  for wireless and with remote access.  I can only thank the team in India regarding th great customer service.Thank you very much

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: frank
Reviews.Content: Bought nine of these last year and so far no problems.  Works as advertised. Would recommend.  Takes about an hour to set up but did get help with the foscam service techs. They were very helpful.  Couldn't have done it without them.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Security Cameras Are Awesome!
Reviews.Author: OhioJanet
Reviews.Content: Everyone, this is a product that you can use for so many things.  I am a commercial real estate agent and this is a great porduct for me.  I have numerous properties and to be able to remotely view the properties, easily, not only saves time but, of course, money.  The technical service on this product is second to  none.  You don't have to know anything about a computer because the technical service will set it up for you.  Thanks Foscam!

Reviews.Title: buyer BEWARE
Reviews.Author: karl
Reviews.Content: bought a set of two that developed problems a couple of months later. I like them while they were working but buyer BEWARE - do not buy from Observeye - a foscam reseller. They have NO customer service at all if you should need help like i did. Go to their website at observeye.com and call the customer service number - you get a vm and no one will call you back if you have any questions.If you want these cameras, buy from Foscam itself, do not buy anything from Observeye...non existence customer service...go to their website and try getting in touch with them by leaving a vm or a note...nobody will call you back.no customer service at Observeeye - do not buy anything from this company -

Reviews.Title: They work for me!
Reviews.Author: Mary O. Thorpe
Reviews.Content: Pro: They work.Support has been great, especially Ralph Mendez was super quick in solving my issue.Great photos via the alarm settings.Con:No zoon on the camera.

Reviews.Title: A little stumble during set up but now flying
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: I thought I was following the instruction very well but I guess not well enough. I couldn't get the camera to connect wireless and remote until I called the Tech Support. A long wait time but worth it. The gentlemen that got my call was very helpful and fast. I will be purchasing another unit for sure. I recommend this unit. Much better than the first one I purchased with nothing but problems and no customer service at all. I would have given this a 5 star if I could have connected without calling customer service.

Reviews.Title: love my camera and the tech support
Reviews.Author: @Steve Needham
Reviews.Content: I love my new Foscam ip cameras.  Tech support has been wonderful.  My thanks to Peter for his help.  I am delighted with these cameras.  Great picture quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Support
Reviews.Author: Nissim
Reviews.Content: Great support, the technician walked me through the process and in 5 min I was able to see a picture in my smartphone. Recommend to everyone this camera.

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: Dthull
Reviews.Content: Solid reliability! Easy setup through NoIP for Internet access.Only downside is clicking noise the cams make occasionally.Other then that...highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good buy on Foscam cameras
Reviews.Author: Gary Maiden "sky hawk"
Reviews.Content: These cameras work very good.  You need to know a little about setting up computers and routers to make these things work.  You can use an app on smart phones to check on your cameras viewing which is very cool.  Also, the camera software will email you pics of movements in front of the camera.  You just set up the email server and the time schedule in the software.  Good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: excellent customer service / technical support
Reviews.Author: Adrian "Customer Service Leader"
Reviews.Content: I was able to set up the camera with ease by needed technical support for the remote access settings. Sandra Williams was extremely knowledgeable and performed the remote access set-up for me.  The manual is not very helpful but once set up the camera is very good.

Reviews.Title: Tech support
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Camera work very well.Tech was very professional. Could not ask for any thing more! Ask for Felix Anderson. Should buy this product. I recommend this product to all. Color is very good. Perfomance is realy good.

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910W wireless/wired Pan & Tilt IP/network camera
Reviews.Author: MaryAnnWalser
Reviews.Content: Foscam F18910W cameraVery good productThe support line was very helpful in assistance with the set upGreat visability

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but VERY hard to set up.
Reviews.Author: Sandstress
Reviews.Content: The camera produces a very high quality image, both regular and night vision. Because it's wireless, you can place it anywhere (indoors) so long as there is a power outlet nearby.  You can view the camera online or on a smart phone.  My one big complaint is that it is extremely complicated to set up unless you are an IT specialist, and the user manual provided is almost no help, as it uses technical computer terms and acronyms without really explaining what they mean.  You will be required to change various settings on your computer and router in order to make the camera work properly.  It took me several hours over the course of several days to get everything set up right.  Ultimately, I was forced to call customer service/technical support for help. That meant being on hold for a very LONG time (in one instance, I was on hold for an hour and a half). Once I finally reached a person, they were able to set up my computer remotely.  For the price and picture quality, I would recommend the camera overall.  Once you get past the initial headache of setting it up, it is a great tool to have for added home security.

Reviews.Title: These work great!
Reviews.Author: JPT "John T."
Reviews.Content: Admittedly I have a little bit of networking experience so it wasn't all that difficult to setup over the network....had the camera's up and running in about 15 minutes, another 15 minutes for port forwarding etc.  After that these are great...video quality is good.. lots of features to use.  The included software is 'ok' at best, but if you get foscam pro for IOS you'll see what could be!  I keep adding more to the house.

Reviews.Title: These work very well
Reviews.Author: Dan Whetzel
Reviews.Content: We use these cameras as baby monitors for our nursery.  When coupled with the iOS App it is great to use these cameras and view the baby from afar with an iPhone or iPad.  THe setup was super simple, and I had them up and running in just a few minutes.  The only thing I find myself wanting is a better zoon capability.

Reviews.Title: Technical support
Reviews.Author: ke
Reviews.Content: Tech support was great. Ralph Mendez with Foscam was exceptional in helping me set this camera up. If having any trouble, contact Foscam directly and let them have control of your computer to set up this camera. Looking forward to setting up the second camera with Foscams help. Would recommend the camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: tmann
Reviews.Content: Ralph mendez just remotely hooked up my foscam F18910W correctly after it stopped working from the initial set up done by a friend. I did call the 1800 # for assistance and was told someone would call me back within an hour which he did. There was no charge and he configured router/no-ip/camera and it is now working again. I have no IT skills and tried to set them up by reading forum's and watching videos but was unable without help from IT guys.

Reviews.Title: just okay
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: these will be great for a baby monitor once she arrives.we have tested these with our 2 cats and the audio in / out works, with about 1/2 to a full second delay both ways.when subject area is backlit, meaning light is going into the camera and not so much on the subject area, the video can be dark and hard to see.this is not a fault of the camera, (its more lighting101) it just needs to be positioned so the light is behind the camera and not going into the camera lens.i love the IR is auto switching in no/very low light.the pan tilt has been useful although not sure how much it will be used or needed in the nursery.would pay more for zoom feature.originally thought we could use these mounted outside the garage however facial recongition at distance over 10ft i would consider useless.  so you could watch someone break in or vandalize but not tell who it was.I am planning to mount the 2nd one under the overhang outside our front porch to monitor/record.  this should be close enough for facial recognition for the distance and lighting(during the day) and possibly with ir at night.I would buy a single unit knowing what I know now just for the nursery.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: Tom Rivera "CyberJunky"
Reviews.Content: Arived as expected. Works as expected. Easy to install and configure. What can I say it does what it suppose it shoud do.

Reviews.Title: Security Focused
Reviews.Author: Mike Bowers
Reviews.Content: This was my second purchase of Foscam wireless cameras.  Unfortunately, I made the mistake of upgrading on this latest purchase.  The problem is that, while these work with my earlier Foscam cameras, the software override prevents the earlier model from sending emails.  There is also a problem with static that keeps you from hearing anything via the camera’s built-in microphones.Although there are a couple of negatives, I still love these cameras.  They were easy to configure and install.  I have my whole house set up so that I can be notified of any movements that should be there.  I was able to save hundreds over the security systems offered in many stores.  Using my own router and laptop I can be notified each time someone comes near my house.Good product.

Reviews.Title: One is better than the other
Reviews.Author: Duffie McLamb
Reviews.Content: One camera works better than the other, One camera has better video than the other. They both get the job done! which I like. They are not difficult to setup, I attached them to the wired network and used an android / iphone app called Fing (free) to discover it and tell me the newly assigned ip address. I typed the address into my web-browser and setup and did all my configurations. Then disconnected it, and placed it where I wanted it, powered it up and they have been working fine.For the price, and durability (within 72 hours) one of them was knocked out off a shelf, and fell seven feet straight to a hardwood floor and didnt break..I plan to purchase a few more, if you looking for a camera with really clear, sharp optics, this is not the camera for you. But if you just want to see whats going, they work fine and you will be happy with them. I configured my router to allow vpn connections, so I am able to vpn into my network. I dont use dyndns, my ip address only changes a few times a year. So I just check to see what the address is every so often. Once I have connected to the network, via vpn I use 3rd party app's on my phone and see whats going on around the home.

Reviews.Title: Tech support
Reviews.Author: greg
Reviews.Content: Had issue with configuring the camera wirelessly and remotely. Ralph was outstanding all issues were resolved.  camera now working great!.

Reviews.Title: My cameras keep crashing!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Slater
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 cameras as I had to buy a new router because the old one crapped out.  I had been using a Panasonic IP/ Network camera but it was not compatible with the new router.  I got the new cameras hooked up and access them while at work but have found a few issues.  I can't get them to work if I use Internet Explorer.  I must use Firefox or Google.  I have issues trying to move the cameras.  To be fair, some of these issues could be because of firewalls at my work place.  But the biggest problem of all is that from time to time the camera just crashes and you need to go home and reset them.  Doesn't do me much good if it won't stay connected.

Reviews.Title: Technical support
Reviews.Author: Frankie
Reviews.Content: Needed help in set up of mail services, Ralph Mendez was very helpful, got me up and running in no time!!!!  The cameras are working real well, lots of features, so far so good.  Highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Very good support.  I struggled to get the system to work.  Turned out it was my Internet Explorer that was the problem and not the cameras.  My wife almost sent my cameras back but I asked her to hold off as I really liked the capabilities of the cameras.  The Tech Support individual (Felix Anderson) was very patient, assessed the potential problem, quickly downloaded a different and free browser and corrected the problem.  20 minutes later, I had a fully functioning system with two cameras both with wireless connectivity and remote access via iPhone.  Thanks Felix!

Reviews.Title: Foscam customer service
Reviews.Author: Fabian Kaempfer
Reviews.Content: I had a problem with the recording path and the customer support was great. They helped me out immediately (harry foster) and he was very helpful and friendly. thanks!I would definitely recommend this camera to everyone. Great value for money and really sharp videos.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Yousaf
Reviews.Content: 1) I was unable to connect to the second camera.My problem was resolved by (Ralph Mendez).  He was very fast and efficient.  I like the product but a little complicated for those who don't know much.  But the service is great and they walked me through the set up.  I do recommend this product to everyone who has similar needs.

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910W
Reviews.Author: Boswanda
Reviews.Content: I love the camera and the Foscam service.  Smith with Foscam was very patient with helping get everything set up to operate effectively.  This was my first IP camera and with some help from Smith, I was up and running in no time.  Even got my iphone app up and working quickly too.  The IR function is wonderful.  The picture is clear.  Very happy with the product and service.

Reviews.Title: I like these... A lot
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: We bought these to use as baby monitors.  Reviews about regular baby monitors were all pretty negative so I decided to use these instead.  I use the wireless feature and have not had any issues since I bought them. Been using them a little over a month.  The set up was really easy, as long as you know about router settings.  I love being able to control every function of these remotely.I'm not sure how long these will last, but for the money, I would say they are well worth it.

Reviews.Title: missing parts.
Reviews.Author: Alec J Scarpellini
Reviews.Content: 2pack sale on amazing claims .9dbi ant. This item was not shipped and the link description leaves them out of the order number.Amazon refunded the price of the ant.As for the cameras..I have 4 working flawlessly.  I have not tried the audio out yet..

Reviews.Title: Only one
Reviews.Author: KillarBlaze007
Reviews.Content: Purchased a two pack. One works fine the second one does not scan the wireless network, nor does it connect when the wireless information is entered manually. Other than that, they work fine viewing at night and during the day. Have not tried the motion detector or any other software features.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: TW
Reviews.Content: These are my first web cams and I could not be happier. I had them both set up in under an hour with my local network and over the internet. I did some research before ordering. I looked on Foscam's support website and found everything I needed. Using the DDNS and port forwarding guides made the setup very easy. I use Firefox and not IE so some of the web based features do not work(multi camera view). This is not an issue for me since I use the Foscam Pro app on my iPhone and iPad. I have not had any sound or video issues like other reviewers. Overall, very good cameras for the money.

Reviews.Title: Awesome cameras for the price
Reviews.Author: Sir Percard
Reviews.Content: These are great cameras for the price.  Video quality is decent and setup is fairly straight forward.  Web interface is simple and easy to use.Pros:  Inexpensive for what you get, simple setup, includes wall mounts and a retractable CAT-5 cable, separate alarm mode and normal still capture, very good night vision, ability to FTP stills, pan & scan mode (vertical, horizontal or both), can access via smartphone (browser or third party app), mirror and flip modes.Cons:  No built in stream recording capability, built in speaker and microphone don't work well, camera will not pan down very far.Even though these are wireless cameras, you have the option to run power over ethernet cables to them, eliminating the need for the power cable.  I wish that the power cable was longer to give you more flexibility in placing them.

Reviews.Title: I'm a FosCam fan. Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Steve - IT Tech
Reviews.Content: I'm a FosCam fan. Great camera!I own 6 of 'em. :)Must have for your own security. I recommend buying the full version of software called: Blue Iris ; as the software the ties them all together. Granted; the camera's work ok without the software but the software adds additional features to fully bring it all together as a working well oiled machine.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Review
Reviews.Author: Awill8128
Reviews.Content: Harry Foster was very helpful in setting up the cameras. Clear picture on both cameras.  They work wirelessly and I can view them on my ipad.  Model # is FI8910W.

Reviews.Title: Foscam installation help review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera provides a sharp clear image. I tested out the IR in my basement with all the lights off and only a sliver of light from under a door and was able to see the room clearly.  It was amazing!!Harry Foster was very helpful and accommadating in getting my cameras up and running.  While running into a few difficulties he was able to resolve them in a very amicable fashion and both of my cameras are now functioning as expected.  Thank you Harry!!

Reviews.Title: Sandra
Reviews.Author: DP
Reviews.Content: The camera is working in the Techincal Service was very helpful thanks.The service Foscam was great to use in i really feel safe with the Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Onur Kadioglu "kadortho"
Reviews.Content: Just got off the phone with Foscam Tech support (Ricky).He was quick and simple and fixed my "outside access" problem pretty easily. I only had a few things wrong in my port mapping settings.All the 8910 owners make sure you have the current firmware update done so that a no-ip host can be added. And if you own a Time Capsule powered by an Apple network like mine, Foscam still works just fine. I have been very satisfied with my two 8910s that use for baby monitoring, and I highly recommended them.Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - Black NEWEST MODEL

Reviews.Title: Foscam Tech Review
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Calvin Harris  Excellant.  Fastest computer programer I've ever seen.  Thank you.  Camera works very well. I recommend the camera and great tech support.

Reviews.Title: Anzen
Reviews.Author: JOHN F MANGIONE,
Reviews.Content: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - Black NEWEST MODELGreat service from foscam Tech Support wonderful TECH Anzen  knows his business  (FOSCAM F18910)

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM CAMERA REVIEW
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Just purchased the 10w... excellent camera. Technical support was very very helpful, Calvin did a great job setting up and troubleshooting my camera. Camera is an excellent value and actually outperforms most of the other expensiver brands.

Reviews.Title: Nice indoor camera to monitor the home
Reviews.Author: Donald Shimizu
